result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas William Felder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT, COUNTS ONE, TWO, THREE AND FOUR:  Pay DNA surcharges, all costs and disbursements. 
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL  FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS ORDERED:  Court ordered monies taken by DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balances remaining, and supervision fees  to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.  Restitution to be paid first.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with:  Cleveland Avenue Citgo or Jatinder M. 6001 W. Cleveland, Milwaukee, WI.; Family dollar Store or Brandon V. 3935 S. 76 Street, Milwaukee, WI; Shell Gas  Company or Marlee W. 6311 S. 13 Street, Milwaukee, WI.; Seven Eleven or Caitlyn F. 1225 W. Rawson Avenue, Oak Creek, WI; or James C. or his residence.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling. Parenting classes/counseling.

AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.
**Conditions apply to all counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, unless previously provided.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
$213.00 to Caitlyn F. owner of Seven Eleven located at 1225 W. Rawson Avenue, Oak Creek, WI. To be paid first.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count one.  Credit for 183 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count two.  Credit for 183 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count three. Credit for 183 days.

records.addlTxt: per order dated November 4, 2015, Appeal 2015AP1075CRNM, the motion to supplement the record is granted. The clerk of circuit court shall, within ten days of the date of this order, transmit the notice of intent described above to the clerk of this court by supplemental return. The clerk of circuit court shall, on the dated of this order accept the filing the no merit report that the court received on November 3, 2015. Felder's deadling for responding to the no merit report is tolled until the date the supplemental return is filed in this court. Attorney Backes shall, no later than November 24, 2015, consult with Felder to ensure he understands his deadline for filing a response to the no merit report, and by that same date, Attorney Backes shall file a document in this court confirming that he has conducted the consultation.

Sentencing Memorandum submitted on behalf of defendant, filed.
/from defendant to the court, filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Thomas William Felder in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Thomas William Felder in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the court that they have resolved this case.  Plea hearing proceeds.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged of the four counts in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  The 9/15/14 jury trial date is vacated.

Attorney A. Lockwood appearing for Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Thomas William Felder not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Eichenlaub not able to appear in court on today's date.  Discussion on the record regarding speedy trial demand and case scheduled for final pre-trial and jury trial.
Court advises parties that if final pre-trial and/or jury trial dates are a conflict for Atty. Eichenlaub, he is to contact the court to request a scheduling conference.

Deputy clerk left telephone message for Atty. Eichenlaub informing him of today's proceedings.
Clerk:  jms

Court set the following filing date:  defense motion due by 7/22/14; State's response due by 8/11/14; defense reply due by 8/18/14.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week prior to the final pretrial date and any alibis are due within the statutory time period.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial and motion hearing (if motions filed) on 8/29/14 at 8:30 a.m. and for SPEEDY jury trial on 9/15/14 at 8:30 a.m.
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court set the matter for status of counsel before Branch 20 on 7/11/14/ at 8:30 a.m.  File retained in court.

Defendant Thomas William Felder in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Defendant Thomas William Felder in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.  Court did order TOT to Justice Point with GPS monitoring; release only for attorney, court and Justice Point appointment; No contact with any of the victims listed, no firearms or weapons; absolute sobriety; no alcohol or controlled substances; random testing.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Thomas William Felder in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Defendant Thomas William Felder in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
